meanings.definition: Relating to the study or deciphering of ancient writing systems.
meanings.sent1: The paleographical symbols on the tablet were difficult to understand.
meanings.sent2: The historian used paleographical techniques to analyze the ancient scrolls.
meanings.sent3: The paleographical puzzle was so tricky that even the cleverest detective got stumped.
meanings.sent4: Her paleographical skills were like a key that unlocked the secrets of the past.
meanings.sent5: The paleographical details were etched in her memory like intricate patterns.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the analysis of historical manuscripts.
meanings.sent1: The paleographical examination revealed hidden meanings in the old documents.
meanings.sent2: Scholars often rely on paleographical evidence to date ancient texts.
meanings.sent3: The paleographical investigation turned into a thrilling adventure for the young researcher.
meanings.sent4: His paleographical expertise was like a magnifying glass, revealing the smallest details.
meanings.sent5: The paleographical analysis shed light on the mysteries of the past.

meanings.definition: The study of ancient handwriting and scripts.
meanings.sent1: She dedicated her life to the paleographical study of medieval manuscripts.
meanings.sent2: The university library houses a vast collection of paleographical works.
meanings.sent3: In the world of paleographical research, every scribble tells a story.
meanings.sent4: The paleographical class was filled with students eager to decode history.
meanings.sent5: His passion for paleographical exploration knew no bounds.
